pr_title: Grpc server can run on different ports on different nodes of the cluster

timeline.bodyText: Log.error("Could not read the Decider Config File: {}", configFilePath, e)
timeline.author: sidheart

replies.bodyText: This file has been removed in the latest update to master.
replies.author: yojs

timeline.bodyText: This import line was added, but I don't see CDEP being added below
timeline.author: sidheart

timeline.bodyText: nit: factor this out into a function since it's used in multiple places
timeline.author: sidheart

timeline.bodyText: I agree with most of the refactor points mentioned in the description of the PR, however, can you explain why we need to use node ids instead of ip+port combo? It would've achieved the same goal, unless I'm missing something.
timeline.author: ktkrg

replies.bodyText: You are right, ip+port will have the same affect. I used the node-id as it is a parameter, on its own (without combining with anything else), is guaranteed to be unique in a cluster.
replies.author: yojs

replies.bodyText: Thanks for answering my question. I'm just thinking about the usecases where ip+port wouldn't change but node id would and if such scenarios are handled in the code if they were not handled in the past. Will take a look again.
replies.author: ktkrg

replies.bodyText: makes sense. Please take a look.
replies.author: yojs

timeline.bodyText: return value is being ignored here. Do we need this change?
timeline.author: ktkrg

replies.bodyText: ya. I was running tests and left it like that. good point !
replies.author: yojs

timeline.bodyText: This annotation should go above the method if you're saying that the returned String may be null
timeline.author: sidheart

replies.bodyText: I think you missed this one, if this is changed I can +1 the diff
replies.author: sidheart

replies.bodyText: I missed this one. Pushed the changes again.
replies.author: yojs

timeline.bodyText: I'm curious, what does this do differently than just directly returning ip?
timeline.author: sidheart

replies.bodyText: you mean why we don't have getIp() instead ?
replies.author: yojs

replies.bodyText: I mean why return "" + ip instead of just return ip?
replies.author: sidheart

replies.bodyText: Yes you are right. It's a no-op for a string
replies.author: yojs

timeline.author: sidheart

timeline.bodyText: Is there a reason you initialize to -1 instead of 0? 0 would make the default behavior the same as before this commit right?
timeline.author: sidheart

replies.bodyText: You are right. That was a miss on my part.
replies.author: yojs

timeline.bodyText: It's ok to remove this @ignore and change grpcConnectionManager = new GRPCConnectionManager(false). TLS semantics are tested elsewhere.
timeline.author: sidheart

replies.bodyText: I added the change for it to get the right files.
replies.author: yojs

timeline.bodyText: It's like a pet name for the node! :)
timeline.author: sidheart

timeline.bodyText: nit: why split this if we aren't distinguishing between the two cases?
timeline.author: sidheart

replies.bodyText: It was just that I was debugging and it makes it easier to put breakpoints to know which branch is returning the error. :)
replies.author: yojs
